body:
Comment 15: 
The problem is what people with really old hardware should do. There is an argument that
they should just throw them away, but not everybody can make this choice. AFAICT, the
first CTR ciphers appeared in openssh 3.7, if compiled against (OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER
>= 0x00905000L).

How about 1.) I do the refactoring for AES-GCM in gosshnew, making it easy to add CBC
2.) somebody prepares a patch for 3DES-CBC and attaches it here. We don't integrate the
patch, but somebody that really needs it can patch his library locally.
